A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
In the official trailers for The Last Jedi\, Luke is seen saying one of his lines in the film\, "This is not going to go how you think."  And indeed\, The Last Jedi takes expectation and twists them into something new and exciting.  While some fans seem to be disappointed that the story didn't follow the plot as they saw it\, the exciting directions taken with Luke\, Rey and most interestingly Kylo Ren make for a truly dynamic film that left me exhilarated.  

While several moments with these characters are surprising\, the turns are believable and work well within the characters and their storylines.  

The film isn't perfect\, and there are some pacing issues in the first half that soften the impact of the front half of the film.  However\, starting with a showdown that is\, perhaps the very best scene in any Star Wars film\, the film takes off and doesn't let up until the finish.  The complexity of the main characters\, both hero and villain\, make this more than just your standard good vs. evil sort of film that the previous Star Wars films have taken\, and left me wanting more.
